title: Netflix Backs Out of Bid for Warner Bros., Paving Way for Paramount Takeover
summary: The move was a stunning development in the long-running corporate battle for the storied media giant.

title: Justice Department Exposed Cooperating Witnesses in Epstein Files
summary: The disclosure is the latest example of how the urgent push to release the files led to the government publicizing information it would normally keep under wraps.

title: How a Close Associate of Epstein’s Found Career Redemption in Japan
summary: Top Japanese officials are backing a tech and entrepreneurship initiative led by Joichi Ito, whose involvement with Jeffrey Epstein may endanger efforts to get the project off the ground.

title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
summary: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.

title: Trump Declared Victory in Minneapolis. But What Did He Accomplish?
summary: The Trump administration came under fire for an operation that turned lethal and politically toxic. But the show of force may also have had a bigger purpose: to serve as a warning.

title: Columbia Student Arrested by ICE in a University Building Is Released
summary: Federal officials had misrepresented themselves to gain access, according to the university. Mayor Zohran Mamdani said President Trump had told him the student would be let go.

title: Mamdani Meets Again With Trump, Emerging With Two Unexpected Victories
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said he and President Trump discussed building housing in New York City, and he appeared to secure the release of a Columbia student detained by ICE on Thursday.

title: Testimony Offers New Details on Justice Dept. Role in Abrego Garcia Prosecution
summary: A top prosecutor, Robert E. McGuire, painted an extraordinary picture of senior Justice Department leaders peering over his shoulder and hurrying him along.

title: U.S. Mortgage Rates Fall Below 6% for First Time in Years
summary: The evidence is patchy on whether lower rates have meaningfully spurred more activity, as the Trump administration floats measures it says will make housing more affordable.

title: What Your DNA Reveals About the Sex Life of Neanderthals
summary: Most people alive today carry fragments of Neanderthal DNA in their genome. Now scientists are gaining a more intimate understanding of the ancient encounters that put it there.

title: What We Know About the Gun Battle Off the Coast of Cuba
summary: Four armed Cubans aboard a Florida-based speedboat died in a gunfight with Cuban border troops on Wednesday, officials said.

title: What to Know About U.S.-Iran Nuclear Talks Amid Trump Threats
summary: President Trump has kept up a steady drumbeat of threats and built up U.S. troops in the region. Iran’s task is to give him a win but also preserve some semblance of nuclear enrichment.

title: A.I. Dating Apps Complicate China’s Efforts to Boost Birthrate
summary: As China grapples with a shrinking population and historically low birthrate, people are finding romance with chatbots instead.

title: Anthropic Says It Cannot ‘Accede’ to Pentagon in Talks Over A.I.
summary: Anthropic said it was standing firm on not having its A.I. used in certain scenarios by the Pentagon, which has imposed a Friday deadline on the company to give unfettered access to its technology.

title: After F.B.I. Raid, Los Angeles School Board Will Discuss Superintendent
summary: Board members will meet Thursday after agents raided the home and office of Alberto Carvalho, the Los Angeles Unified School District superintendent. The F.B.I. also searched the Florida home of a consultant with ties to the schools chief.

title: Why Are So Many Democrats Running for California Governor?
summary: With California’s political machine on the wane, nobody has emerged as a clear front-runner. Democrats worry that nine of their candidates could split the vote and hand Republicans a win.

title: In Texas, Crenshaw faces primary challenger, a test for MAGA
summary: Representative Dan Crenshaw, who has at times clashed with President Trump and his allies, is facing a conservative challenger in Tuesday’s primary.

title: Why Are So Many Teen Girls Still Tearing Their A.C.L.s?
summary: For years, ligament tears have been a crisis among young athletes — even though a few simple exercises can prevent them.

title: Jesse Jackson Memorials Begin in Chicago
summary: Mourners lined up outside Rainbow PUSH, the organization Mr. Jackson founded decades ago. He died last week at 84.

title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
summary: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

title: They Helped Women Fight Online Abuse. They Were Barred From the U.S.
summary: The founders of HateAid, a German human-rights group that helps victims of online attacks, were accused by the Trump administration of being part of a “global censorship-industrial complex.”

title: Bird Losses Are Accelerating, New Study Finds
summary: Scientists studying data collected over more than three decades found accelerating losses. Their research offers clues about the causes.

title: ‘We’re Going to the Moon and Mars’
summary: The new head of NASA predicts a manned mission to Mars in 10 years.

title: Mexico’s Cartel Fight Is a Terrifying High-Wire Act
summary: As drug gangs have become more deeply embedded in Mexico, narco blockades have become a way for them to visibly assert their power.

title: War or a Deal? U.S. and Iran Discuss What’s Next
summary: Also, mortgage rates fall below 6 percent. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Venezuela’s Capital, Laid Low by Misrule, Is Stirring Back to Life
summary: New restaurants are popping up in Caracas. Nightclubs are bursting at the seams. The streets are eerily safe — with big exceptions. Could a revival be on the horizon?

title: In Landmark Trial, Plaintiff Says Social Media Harm Started at Age 6
summary: The plaintiff, a 20-year-old identified only as K.G.M., took the stand to testify against Meta and Instagram in a bellwether case over tech addiction.

title: N.Y. Man With China Ties Charged With Marijuana Trafficking in Oklahoma
summary: Sin Tung Chan was a member of a prominent hometown association in the city, one of hundreds of social clubs that often maintain close ties with the Chinese government.
